<https://github.com/vim/vim/commit/ce436de5a9b94886baf023b3d22193cc68d0e9d1|patch 8.2.0423: in some environments a few tests are expected to fail>
patch 8.2.0423: in some environments a few tests are expected to fail

Problem:    In some environments a few tests are expected to fail.
Solution:   Add $TEST_MAY_FAIL to list tests that should not cause make to
            fail.

attachments.fallback: GitHub: patch 8.2.0423: in some environments a few tests are expected to fail · vim/vim@ce436de
attachments.title: patch 8.2.0423: in some environments a few tests are expected to fail · vim/vim@ce436de
attachments.text: Problem: In some environments a few tests are expected to fail. Solution: Add $TEST_MAY_FAIL to list tests that should not cause make to fail.

text:
<https://github.com/vim/vim/commit/98be7fecac80b30c5a323b67903eb1d0094007ea|patch 8.2.0417: Travis CI config can be improved>
patch 8.2.0417: Travis CI config can be improved

Problem:    Travis CI config can be improved.
Solution:   Remove COVERAGE variable. Add load-snd-dummy script. add "-i NONE"
            to avoid messages about viminfo. (Ozaki Kiichi, closes #5813)

<https://github.com/vim/vim/commit/f1ec378b014efb9897422c40369a6462163a512a|patch 8.2.0420: Vim9: cannot interrupt a loop with CTRL-C>
patch 8.2.0420: Vim9: cannot interrupt a loop with CTRL-C

Problem:    Vim9: cannot interrupt a loop with CTRL-C.
Solution:   Check for CTRL-C once in a while.  Doesn't fully work yet.

attachments.text: Problem: Vim9: cannot interrupt a loop with CTRL-C. Solution: Check for CTRL-C once in a while. Doesn't fully work yet.

text:
<https://github.com/vim/vim/commit/9645e2d9fc8a591f1db30383caccf71d40e0810c|patch 8.2.0421: interrupting with CTRL-C does not always work>
patch 8.2.0421: interrupting with CTRL-C does not always work

Problem:    Interrupting with CTRL-C does not always work.
Solution:   Recognize CTRL-C while modifyOtherKeys is set.

attachments.fallback: GitHub: patch 8.2.0421: interrupting with CTRL-C does not always work · vim/vim@9645e2d
attachments.title: patch 8.2.0421: interrupting with CTRL-C does not always work · vim/vim@9645e2d
attachments.text: Problem: Interrupting with CTRL-C does not always work. Solution: Recognize CTRL-C while modifyOtherKeys is set.

text:
<https://github.com/vim/vim/commit/0f1563ffee4397f5b379517c41b7c9a977fd2e22|patch 8.2.0422: crash when passing popup window to win_splitmove()>
patch 8.2.0422: crash when passing popup window to win_splitmove()

Problem:    Crash when passing popup window to win_splitmove(). (john Devin)
Solution:   Disallow moving a popup window. (closes #5816)

attachments.fallback: GitHub: patch 8.2.0422: crash when passing popup window to win_splitmove() · vim/vim@0f1563f
attachments.title: patch 8.2.0422: crash when passing popup window to win_splitmove() · vim/vim@0f1563f
attachments.text: Problem: Crash when passing popup window to win_splitmove(). (john Devin) Solution: Disallow moving a popup window. (closes #5816)
